titlestmt.titleproper: Wilhelm Groener Correspondence, 1915-1938: Preliminary Finding Aid MC066

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-30 15:21:39 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid content adheres to that prescribed by Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

did.abstract: Consists of copies of Groener's correspondence held in the National Archives, Washington D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of copies of Groener's correspondence held in the National Archives, Washington, D.C., including miscellaneous correspondence (1915-1935), papers dealing with his dismissal as Reichswehrminister (minister of war) in 1932, letters from Kurt von Schleicher (1919-1934), and letters to General Major A. D. Alarich von Gleich and others (1930-1938).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. For quotations that are fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For those few instances beyond fair use, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold the copyright and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from the Mudd Library to move forward with their use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Collection Title, Box and Folder Number; Special Collections, Princeton University Library.
